Click on their heads until they die, rinse and repeat.

The game's easy to pick up but hard to master. Apart from aim accuracy and reaction time, there are various spray patterns to learn, movement, general knowledge of various maps, grenade throws for each map section, etc. This high skill ceiling makes it endlessly replayable and addictive.

The game suffers from cheaters and toxic players, but that's what the mute and report buttons are for, along with a huge reserve of naive hope that things  will get better.
